pr_title: [#2026] Renaming config property for ACK timeout of MQTT adapter.

timeline.message:
[#2026] Renaming config property for ACK timeout of MQTT adapter.

The new property is called "HONO_MQTT_SEND_MESSAGE_TO_DEVICE_TIMEOUT" which will replace the current "HONO_MQTT_COMMAND_ACK_TIMEOUT" property. This is done in order to provide an abstraction for the configuration of protocols using a bidirectional connection (i.e. MQTT and AMQP).

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText:
This method doesn't seem to be used. I would have expected it to be used in the place that up til now getCommandAckTimeout() was used in (i.e. in CommandSubscriptionsManager.startTimer).
For backwards compatibility, the commandAckTimeout value should still be used if sendMessageToDeviceTimeout isn't set.
But then there is a conflict with using ClientConfigProperties#getSendMessageTimeout() as default for sendMessageToDeviceTimeout. That means that assigning the default value of sendMessageToDeviceTimeout in the constructor would have to be changed (in favor of applying the order of precedence of the 3 possible values in the getSendMessageToDeviceTimeout method above).
But, I now think that using the sendMessageTimeout value of the messaging configuration properties as default value might be too confusing here after all. It's also the first time that we have properties of different endpoints influence one another. And also from the constructor signature it doesn't become clear, which actual ClientConfigProperties are to be used here.
I think, for the time being (until we have an extra set of some default properties), we should just use the 1 second actual default value of sendMessageTimeout as default for sendMessageToDeviceTimeout, not using the messaging client properties here. WDYT?
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText:
Well, actually I found it confusing when I implemented it but I blamed it on me working on my first issue on Hono.
Just to make sure I got you right: we would remove the reference to ClientConfigProperties completely then from the constructor arguments (meaning not only in the MQTT adapter but as well in the AMQP adapter)?
replies.author: fkaltner

replies.bodyText: Okay, I reverted my changes and added a new method which will determine the effective timeout property which is now used in CommandSubscriptionsManager.startTimer
replies.author: fkaltner

[#2026] Adding a new configuration property for MQTT adapter called "HONO_MQTT_SEND_MESSAGE_TO_DEVICE_TIMEOUT" which will replace the current "HONO_MQTT_COMMAND_ACK_TIMEOUT" property. This is done in order to provide an abstraction for the configuration of protocols using a bidirectional connection (i.e. MQTT and AMQP).

This fixes #2026

Signed-off-by: Florian Kaltner <florian.kaltner@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText:
Nit pick: Allowing a value of 0 here will lead to an IllegalArgumentException in vertx.setTimer(). If we want to allow 0  here (as in the AmqpAdapterProperties), we should skip creating a vertx timer in that case.
(Using 0 here of course makes little sense and should possibly only be done for debugging slow-responding devices in a test system.)
